subdistro.title: Manjaro
subdistro.desc:
# Manjaro

Manjaro is an Arch Linux-based distribution that aims to provide a user-friendly experience without sacrificing the power and flexibility of Arch Linux. It comes with a variety of desktop environments, including Xfce, KDE, and GNOME, allowing users to choose their preferred desktop environment during installation.

Features

  • User-Friendly Installation: Manjaro features a user-friendly installer that simplifies the installation process for users, especially those new to Arch Linux.
  • Access to Arch Linux Repositories: Manjaro users have access to the Arch User Repository (AUR) and official Arch Linux repositories, allowing them to install a wide range of software.
  • Rolling Release Model: Similar to Arch Linux, Manjaro follows a rolling release model, providing users with the latest software updates.

Pros and Cons

Pros:
1. User-friendly installation
2. Access to Arch Linux repositories
3. Rolling release model

Cons:
1. Delayed updates
2. Less control compared to Arch
